definition: the brightly burning gas that you see coming from a fire
a sudden strong feeling
an angry email, or an email that insults someone
in: He sat by the fire staring at the flames.
in flames  (=burning): The whole building was soon in flames.
burst into/go up in/erupt in flames: A car had overturned and burst into flames.
douse/smother/extinguish the flames  (=stop a fire burning): Bryan smothered the flames with his coat.
flame of: a flame of passion/anger/desire/hope
shoot someone down in flames

to suddenly become hot and red with emotion:
to send an angry or insulting email:

to burn brightly or more brightly:

an angry or offensive message that is sent by email or left on a message board, etc.
to send an angry or offensive message to someone using email, or by leaving it on a message board, etc.:

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
when you can rap and spit straight flames
To be really good, the best, or awesome.

A flame is noun associated with the action of flaming, what people do when they express a strongly held opinion without holding back any emotion. 

Although flames often get out of hand, they have a purpose in the ecology of cyberspace. Many flames are aimed at teaching someone something (usually in overstated language) or stopping them from doing something (like offending other people). Flame messages often use more brute force than is strictly necessary, but that's half the fun.

Netiquette does ask that you consider the art of flaming before pulling out the flame-thrower.
To insult someone electronically, or otherwise.  Sometimes to be a group insult.
To insult a person you are arguing with over the internet in hopes of reviving your argument.
